commissioner_section.bio: Barr. Enyinna Victor Onuegbu, KSC, is the current Commissioner for Lands, Survey and Physical Planning in Imo State under Governor Hope Uzodinma. He hails from Umuokoro-Eziama in Ngor Okpala LGA and holds the traditional title of Ebekuodike (Prime Minister) of his community. A trained lawyer, Onuegbu began his legal career in Owerri after NYSC. He is married to Magistrate Uche Onuegbu, and they have four children. His early political mentorship came from the late Senator Arthur Nzeribe, whom he served as legal adviser and political aide. Onuegbu's political journey spans several decades, beginning in the SDP and later the Democratic Party of Nigeria. He has served as Commissioner for Power and Chief Political Adviser to the Governor before returning as Lands Commissioner in 2025. He is known for reforming the land sector by eliminating irregularities, enforcing due process, and digitizing land records in partnership with the Imo Geographic Information Service (IGIS). His leadership promotes transparency and public trust in land administration. Barr. Onuegbu is respected for his professionalism, cultural values, and loyalty to the Uzodinma administration. Despite political speculation, he remains focused on delivering efficient public service without pursuing personal political ambition.

associated_agencies.name: Imo State Geographic Information Service (IGIS)
associated_agencies.description: Established under the Imo State Lands Administration and Geographic Information Service (Establishment) Law 2021. Responsible for digitizing land records, geospatial data, land registry services, land-title issuance, and land administration enforcement. Operates the IGIS Service Centre supporting citizens and government agencies with maps, reports, and spatial analytics.

associated_agencies.name: Imo Housing Corporation
associated_agencies.description: Works with the ministry on matters related to land allocation, built property, and regulatory compliance.

associated_agencies.name: Owerri Capital Development Authority (OCDA)
associated_agencies.description: Collaborates on urban planning, zoning, and development oversight in the state capital.

services: Issuance of Certificate of Occupancy (C-of-O): Provides legal titles to landowners
Processing of land allocations and leaseholds: Administers residential, commercial, industrial, and agricultural plots
Title verification and land search reports: Confirms ownership and legal status of properties
Survey plan approval: Ensures all land measurements comply with state survey standards
Geospatial mapping services: Uses modern GIS tools to produce maps, layouts, and land demarcations
Boundary demarcation and re-establishment: Helps resolve land disputes and maintains legal boundaries
Development Control & Building Permit Approvals: Regulates construction and ensures compliance with town planning laws
Site Analysis & Planning Advice: Provides expert guidance on land use, zoning, and infrastructure layouts
Urban renewal and master plan implementation: Ensures organized growth in urban and rural environments
